woke up at am because something is bothering me couldn’t sleep so i thought i’d find help and found this reddit community thank you for reading this and taking the time to respond about one month ago i found out that my daughter years of age was struggling with depression and we have since found her mental help by connecting her with a therapist just last night my son years of age started crying and said he felt he was going to die when he started crying my heart just fell to my stomach and i felt as though i had failed now twice as a parent my true understanding of what i believe my son was trying to say was he was sad bored and struggling with life my sons routine is usually go to school remotely on zoom until about pm; take a break; finish homework at around pm; play roblox and watch youtube until dinner time ; play roblox and watch youtube and go to sleep normally when he is playing roblox he is on facetime with his closest cousin and they play talk a lot however he has not been as available recently throughout the week and only more so on weekends i of course will jump in and play roblox or watch a show with my son at least once every other day for about hours also i make it a point everyday during dinner to talk as a family and ask everyone how their day was my wife too will jump in and play roblox with him for about two hours that is the normal routine perhaps this has been my down fall and not giving my kids enough of my time during the pandemic our routine has changed dramatically my wife and i in efforts to keep us safe have remained in doors we may have taken it to the extreme and only really gone out for food until recently the kids almost always stay at home while i go get the food perhaps this has been my biggest mistake by isolating the kids too much i’ve since tried changing our ways and starting getting out for walks or taking the kids to drive around the neighborhood for example today we walked to target and purchased some treats and new version of uno we played that after dinner for about an hour this does not seem to have fixed anything but i’m going to continue trying to go outside this post is getting long so i’ll get to the questions am i a total idiot by letting my son watch youtube and play roblox all day without restrictions do i just need to man up and spend the entire afternoon with my kids do you think this is large in part to the isolation of the pandemic or perhaps the scare of being unsafe because of the pandemic any advice is welcome and i appreciate your honestly thank you i’m just so very hurt by this and want to be a better father

you’re not an idiot you’re a parent in the early oughts during a pandemic who is trying to figure out how to fill the day for your kid i definitely don’t recommend so much screen time for kids his age there are real world physically mentally stimulating ways to show him how to entertain himself with his imagination or to play together • reading together • listening to music and having a dance off • creating something together like paper planes with a penny to affect pitch • each if you draws a picture and you pass them to each other to color however you want • make a big loose scribble and have him decide what it looks like he then takes a thick marker and outlines the thing he sees in the scribble and colors it • you can take turns drawing and the other person guesses what it is • make a boat with a rubber band and pieces of wooden popsicle stick to twist in it to propel the boat forward in the bath and have a boat race • you can make a cardboard fort and draw furniture around in it or make a blanket fort and tape paper cutout furniture in it • write a story together sentence by sentence each of you switching back and forth so it’s written together and can lead anywhere • maybe play “lava” in the living room or find more board or card games to play you definitely want to get his body moving every day which will release endorphins the “feel good” hormones if he tuckers himself out each day he’ll sleep better and it can help reduce his funk i totally support his gaming especially since it includes socializing but being stationary in front of a screen for so long can breed depression and can lead to him losing sight of how to help himself feel better when gaming doesn’t always “fix” the funk when he’s older

that sounds like a lot of screen time for a seven year old i get it we’re in a pandemic and everything is different but he should be doing other things too outside time is great playing with toys arts and crafts family games reading books etc i don’t think you need to entertain him yourself but more family interaction is always good just aim for a better balance of his time

i feel like your taking this to personally this hole situation has been hard for everyone i do think that it is important to get the kids out of the house as much as possible they need some nature and probably some vitamin d from the sun maybe try going on walks in the neighborhood it can't be healthy to be cooped up in the house all the time you can still get out of the house and be safe our kids start going crazy when they have been in the house too long we do not take them to the store and i know they miss that

you guys sound like amazing parents parenting during this pandemic is new waters for all of us i was trying to do the responsible thing and basically shut us off from the world and covid but i noticed my toddler became more restless so try taking them out more on the weekends when you know certain places will be more empty for example i take my daughter out to the park around am donut shops around am certain stores when i know they’ll be empty your kids are also older so they’re able to wear a mask so that’s great opens up a bunch of things to do we also do a lot of hiking arts and crafts i think this absolutely has to do with being isolated during a pandemic and not being in school it’s easy for us adults to adjust because we understand that there is a pandemic but we really just uprooted our kids lives school stopped socializing stopped basically the normal stopped i don’t think you have to spend the whole afternoon with them maybe just take a few hours to change it up for them so things aren’t so mundane

you need to drastically cut that screentime and make sure your son gets outside time and independent play time with actual toys every day he needs to develop skills to deal with boredom and frustration and big feelings and screen time is a crutch that you are letting him overuse it’s helping him set aside ignore feelings instead of being inside his own head and dealing with them and then at the end of the day the feelings are still there and he hasn’t had a chance to process them i get it parenting in a pandemic is parenting on hard mode for sure but you’ve gotta detox that screen addiction and teach your son some healthier coping strategies or you are setting him up for long term misery eta sorry this sounds so harsh it’s not intended that way i think you’re on the right track—you’ve recognized the problem and you’re taking steps to fix it that is good parenting

this resonates so much i'm black and have a dark skin tone around was when i also started to have these thoughts my mom's approach was a slow drip of positive black influences for example she would give me beautiful black barbie dolls to play with take me to plays musicals shows featuring black artists e g alvin ailey give me books that spoke about confidence in how you look expose me to potential role models that looked like me expose me to musicians that looked like me back then this looked like buying their cassette cds leaving magazines around the house especially bathrooms that were specific to black culture essence ebony etc we occasionally had more serious talks but really seeing all these beautiful examples of dark skinned people over the course of my formative years helped me see that i could be beautiful too i emphasize that it was a slow drip we didn't have black is beautiful proverbial signs all over the house it was just a steady showcase of black positivity

this is so sad but unfortunately so common even in households where parents do everything they can to teach their kids to love themselves present positive black brown role models etc etc there is so much anti blackness ingrained in our society from media entertainment to even language and bc we're dealing with kids the underlying intent doesn't matter think about how often in cartoons movies etc the bad guy character either wears black or has some black feature that is contrasted by a good version that doesn't look at scar vs mufasa for instance we have kids and my wife and i were laser focused on this issue while trying to make sure we don't burden our kids with such a complex problem we want our kids to be comfortable in their own skin one thing we did was that as soon as they were old enough to draw paint people anytime the picture was of themselves or the family we tried to make sure they used colors that more or less matched our skin tone her parents need to try and figure out where she's hearing these messages and cut them out of her life starting with roblox

i went through a phase in elementary school where i only hung out with boys i dressed in baggy boy clothes i had my hair short and i told my parents i wanted to be a boy i am so glad that happened in the s before anybody would have freaked out and blown it out of proportion i had been emotionally abused by women from a young age and became very shy where the girls my age wanted to gossip and role play and make friends in a way i wasn't comfortably with i preferred to be alone in nature or play simple competitive games because that was easier for me that just so happened to be more like how the boys played i didn't like feeling controlled by my mom's fashion choices for me which were girly and i idolized my older sister who was rebellious so i dressed like she dressed and i imitated my boy cousins who were like big brothers to me i wanted to feel closer to my step dad i think so i tried to engage in boy behaviors with him like playing basketball and going to baseball games it lasted a couple of years before i got bored with the trying of it and i just learned to like what i like and be who i am anyway there are complex and highly varied reasons a young child would say something like i want to be not what i am and it's not necessarily an identity crisis listen to your gut because nobody knows your child better than you at this age not even he does honestly

we don’t pigeon hole gender stuff much at our house when my kid was they wanted boobs and at was obsessed with she ra and wanted “she ra hair” they also like voltron and dinosaurs and wrestling and mermaids we’re all just… people i think the best thing we can is create space for all the variables my kid is amab and it’s a long story but at currently use he they pronouns and present as male i don’t think they’re trans i’m sure they’re straight i’m pretty sure what they want when they use “they” or say they’re “neither” is freedom from being restricted to gender roles especially some of the more narrow macho ones they might be seeing at school so much of it doesn’t…mean anything it’s not color preference it’s not hair length it’s not wearing pants it’s not… anything as i told my kid you’re a person with x body part who has long hair who likes x y z who is attracted to b who… etc kids really start to notice gender around that age and my guess is he sees girls being treated differently or behaving differently or having different interests encouraged and he’s subconsciously thinking… gee i wish i could have that it’s much more socially acceptable for women to be into “male things” than for men to be into traditionally feminine things and men lose out in some ways kids notice everything

first off be happy he’s comfortable enough with his mom to tell her how he’s feeling secondly you definitely didn’t do anything wrong to let him watch the age appropriate shows he likes and let him play with toys he likes don’t try to talk him out of it it might change or it might not i have a few friends who were assigned the wrong gender at birth most of them knew already as toddlers or at least knew some of them are well in their fifties so they didn’t have the words for it when they were small they were “different” just treat it like it’s not a big deal and make sure he knows you’ll love him no matter what it may be nothing it may also be the first step on a long and difficult journey but there’s definitely no rush in knowing which way it will go the only thing you need to do is show him you love and accept him for who he is

thanks to roblox and youtube we had something really similar happen with my daughter same age we had child safe settings on the computer but never realized it didn’t work on google chrome only internet explorer don’t beat yourself up but i would definitely delete roblox i believe it needs to be installed on the computer for her to use it so delete the program that allows her to use the site and block the site mine was actually pretty ok with getting rid of it we had a talk about it and i know how hard it is to not freak out when you see something like that just try to talk with her calmly about it so that she feels like she can tell you things in the future have you had “the talk” with her yet i’d talked to her about sex briefly a few weeks before because my sister was having a baby and she was asking questions and knew virtually nothing about where babies came from but it is really hard to talk about what they’ve seen like i tried to basically tell my daughter that any crazy person can put things on the internet and that they can put some really weird stuff up there but sex is supposed to be a really special thing for two adults who have known each other a long time and love each other not something that people turn into something weird and put on the internet but people are crazy and so things like that end up on the internet it’s so hard to talk about without making them feel so embarrassed > i would be really careful about youtube too maybe put some screen time restriction on your computer so that she can only use it during certain hours when your home since you mentioned anime i want to warn you about those gacha life videos too it seems like a cute app for dressing up little characters but the youtube videos are almost always really messed up like of them even if they seem normal at first you’ll find something inappropriate if you watch the whole video try to steer her away from gaming channels too because that’s just going to make her want to play roblox and stuff like that more > it’s hard but for me i had to really find other things that my daughter likes to do like rollerblading riding bikes drawing on the computer or in good old paper she still plays her switch and has more than enough video games on there and a few on my phone as well just stay away from roblox no matter what and be really careful with youtube those gacha videos are what started my daughter googling “boobs” and she went down the rabbit hole for about ten minutes and ended up on some awful site we’ve been so much better off after taking a break from the computer and deleting roblox it was all she wanted to do for a while there she kind of reset after a week or so without it and is way more responsible with her internet time now only sometimes year old posting edits on youtube yes or no my year old loves roblox and making little “edits” she calls them looks like square people dancing to a song to me but apparently it’s a thing last winter she was nearing subscribers and was very excited about the whole thing then she had a mental health crisis cut on herself very lightly but still… and wound up in a behavioral health hospital for a week she’s much better now on meds and in therapy she asked this morning if she could resume her edits on youtube we ended all that during her crisis and she was fine with a break she says it gives her enjoyment and something to busy her mind i don’t want to make parenting decisions based on fear but i admit i’m afraid of this one looking to the group on a “what would you do” kind of basis

with comments disabled the only residual risk would be getting teased in person for putting herself out there creatively and putting too much weight on social media likes views neither of those are exclusively youtube issues also both are things she'll have to learn to manage by herself sooner or later on the flipside you have a child who is passionate about a creative activity and taking their cue from you about how to shape their relationship with it this could be the beginning of a lifelong hobby or even a career or it could just be a brief exploration or fad there's no way of knowing but creativity is a nice thing to encourage

in all honesty i would hesitate to allow a year old to have a youtube channel but i would *never* let a mentally fragile year old have any sort of youtube or instagram or whatever account people are absolutely brutal online

screen addiction so my going on year old is constantly having to be glued to a screen i try not to make a huge deal about it but the tv in his room just broke and i honestly feel he’s too young to even have a tv in his room and he won’t sleep in there anymore i work graves and i’d come home in the middle of the night and he would be playing games or looking for something to watch more often than not his mom and i just got into a huge argument because ever since he broke his tv in his room he has to be in either the living room or our room with the tv on he gets whiny and says “i’m scared ” and i tried telling his mom that we need to help show him there isn’t anything to be scared of he also gets super aggressive and mean if we kick him off roblox or youtube like if he can’t have those things he becomes extremely mean and have tantrums i feel he shouldn’t have had much screen time as he does i don’t feel it’s normal for a five year olds to be conditioned to having a tv on in their room at night and i don’t feel it’s healthy

it does sound like it’s becoming a problem you can try setting boundaries like putting a time limit on how much screen time he gets and slowly lowering it over time but this is going to be so hard cold turkey would probably be harder initially but will give you results more quickly vs trying to wean slowly there is lots of data about screen time and young children find some and sit down to have a serious discussion with your partner about the situation

you’ve gotta take away all the screens no more when i was a kid we didn’t even have a tv he will be fine it’s gonna be rough for a week or so but just offer him ideas of other things to do and be clear that his being bored is not your problem because he has plenty of other things he could do eventually he will cave and do other stuff and after a couple weeks he probably won’t even ask for screens anymore my ex got our girls addicted to screens and it was awful at my new place we don’t even have a tv they hated me for a week or so but now they have a ton of other things they like to do and haven’t even asked about tv or tablets or anything since that first week it can be done at that age it isn’t too hard to change habits and interests the longer you let it go the harder it will be though

you're absolutely correct in that this is not healthy behavior you need to start setting limits with him we have only one tv and it's in our living room i don't allow our daughter to watch youtube because she will mindless scroll through videos for hours if we let her instead we will watch a movie together on the tv in the living room usually she loses interest in the movie and opts to go play with toys or color half way through i would start with clearly communicating to your son that he is to only have hours of screens a day after that time is used up he can do other activities such as play or draw and also tell him that since he broke his tv he will not be getting another one this will also teach him consequences it will be hard at first and expect a lot of tantrums but just stand your ground it will improve and will be much healthier for him in the long run your wife needs to be on board as well
no tv in the bedroom no tv in the bedroom no tv in the bedroom

he needs a detox kids shouldn’t have tvs in their room and should have limited access to the main tv game consoles set time limits on all devices to start and tell him the time frame of when he can be on a game remove access to the tv in your room as well so he gets used to not having a tv associated with room time it’s going to be tough the first few days but he will adjust and be better off for it

just for some perspective op i am a mom to my oldest is my husband is in the military and i am alone a lot we have no family nearby nor any one who could babysit my kids get their fair share of tv time; but no one has a tv in their room no one has an ipad or tablet they have never played video games i can almost guarantee you that the problems in behaviour stem from a the screen time the kid is not getting an opportunity to become a kid there are so many great resources on instagram for you and your wife to check out hours outside is one account i follow that has a lot of information regarding the downsides to screen time for kids the good news is he is still young and can easily bounce back you guys can do this a little bit of good old fashioned research can perhaps help you guys with feeling good about the transition to less screen time i just want to elaborate i am in no way shaming or patting myself on the back we are allll literaly just doing the best we can good luck

memes being shared that aren't appropriate such as mild nudity more mature dirty jokes and even some mentions of violence that didnt feel good to see her talk abt especially on a chat site i never gave her permission to use oh and sailors they curse like sailors i confiscated her computer for the entire summer and by doing so she had an awesome productive creative summer break not staring at a screen in the last few days of summer i allowed her to get on roblox only and check in with her friends with the promise she wouldn't be on discord or anything else i didn't know abt today while she's been using the laptop i asked her to bring it to me so i could print something really quickly as i prepare the file i notice little chats pop up tiny in the corner of the screen i wouldn't have even noticed if someone didn't send a chat sure enough she's on discord again but with a kid i don't recognize chats going back to the very day her privileges were restored the content and messages were similar to the first time nothing pornographic but some with less clothes suggestive chats dirty jokes etc and sailors they still curse like sailors i was a teen mom and have been my daughters only things i prob don't even know u should do i hate being mean and cold to her and i really want her to trust sharing things with me we've spoken about how she needs to earn my trust as well i just need some solid advice even tho i've been a mom for yrs i absolutely feel like a brand new mom again with the things coming up now that she is a pre teen middle schooler i never had a steady routine my my so who was is essential and i tag out when we're both home non work days but during the week i'm not back at work yet he'll get home shower change and then take the child off my hands that gives me time to eat in peace play a video game bathe in peace etc i still do bedtime but it's at least hours a day during the work week that allows me to breathe and since we started doing that i haven't needed breaks as often it was worse in the beginning the tag outs are exactly what it sounds like one of us will tell the other that we're tagging out for x number of minutes or hours and that lets the other person know they're on the hook for the child it's really helped both of us honestly

i am literally in the same boat and year old my husband and i are wfh in jobs that been made busier by the pandemic we're all losing our shit we work all day eat dinner and hang out with the kids for a bit do the bedtime routine and then go back to work to try to finish the stuff we couldn't get done because of the distractions during the day so it feels like it never stops i've got the adhd and i have been coping well for years but i desperately need the structure of the office i cannot function like this and i've started taking medication that i had left over from when it runs out i'm fucked because getting a script for it again is going to be a nightmare my poor kids are being raised by frozen and sesame street we are literally just throwing screens at them to get through the day this has to be terrible for their development i loved having them in daycare they were learning so much and i was always excited to see them for a while they were right next to my office and my daughter and i would get lunch all the time my husband and i are coping sort of by giving each other tiny breaks we take turns watching the kids for a bit while the other one goes and sits somewhere quietly for a few minutes if you're the one who gets up with the kids on the weekend it's understood that you get a nap or a couple of hours of alone time later in the day my husband usually gets up with them on saturday and i do sunday we also split the kids between us a lot which makes them more manageable it's also how we do the things we want to do my husband will take my older child and get her to hang out while he plays guitar i'll take the little one out to the tiny backyard while i garden edit my husband and i also have laundry parties where we hang out and talk and fold laundry while we watch something on tv together this counts as a date now

hubby and i do ‘sick days’ where we take turns usually once every weeks and each pick our day which means if it’s my day i do it all like a single parent from cooking cleaning kids etc it’s a guilt free way for him to be to be selfish sleep in take time for himself hunker in a bedroom basement alone to watch a movie or whatever knowing that he’s going to be wearing the other hat soon and it will be his turn to do it all when it’s my turn i usually have to literally lock myself in the bedroom because the kids naturally flock to me to meet their needs lol it also helps us be empathetic to each other and laugh at how f’n hard it is to keep a house running and children alive lol

totally feel the same i can’t handle regular basic crap anymore like feeding them every second i’ve given up a lot of the stuff i used to do for everyone it’s just too much kids now get their own breakfast and snacks dad or i will do lunch or dinner at first i felt like i needed to control everything and that wasn’t working the kids are and have ideas and thoughts beyond what i think lol but what i did realize is i have some anxiety in parenting i used the youper app that helps you track how you are feeling i tend to have good days when i have time by myself even if just an hour to run to the grocery store and when i get to spend time and do something with one kid like going on a bike ride with one kid making dinner with one kid going to take the dog for a walk with one kid being home with one kid while dad takes the other two out i think it’s the complaining and requests and bickering when everyone is together that is my anxiety trigger maybe try taking one kid somewhere with you or splitting up the kids so you can focus on the one good luck parenting is tough in normal circumstances and even more frustrating without the teachers or other adult carers to help

baby gates sometimes baby gates are just the only answer when i have been touched out when i can't take another sticky baby kiss or whine for mama to fix something sometimes it's just the only thing i can do to preserve my sanity fill up the kiddo's biggest no spill sippy cup give him a bowl of snacks turn on paw patrol or blippy and then set the baby gate giving him run of the main living room playroom and bathroom he's almost so potty trained and i don't keep anything in that bathroom i'd be worried about him getting into i can retreat to the computer room or the other living room with a book where i can still hear him if he needs me but he can't physically reach me also i've never been one for schedules but i've been putting him to bed regularly about pm because he will sleep a straight hours so i get between and hours of adult time with no baby it's the only way to keep my sanity right now with not being able to take him out to the park daycare etc

i don’t know how to “play” i’ve been reading about the importance of play for kids in stressful situations like maybe a global pandemic and i realized i actually have no idea how to play with my kid she’s and into dancing to pop music and roblox i don’t want to play roblox with her because she has way too much screen time as it is also i hate roblox; it’s so boring i was a working mom before coronavirus and i didn’t have to think about this subject that much i’d come home for dinner hang out and watch a movie help with homework and then go to bed weekends would be so busy with activities there was rarely any unstructured play time now i’m unemployed temporarily i hope and home all day how do i play with an year old i’ve tried engaging her in crafts and games but she just can’t sit still that long and loses interest very quickly any ideas bonus points if it’s also fun for an adult

you might be interested in the book playful parenting by lawrence cohen it's more about playing will solve all your parenting problems than about how to play per se but it does have sections about how to play good thing too since it solves all your parenting problems apparently and it's full of anecdotes of examples of an adult playing with a child that could inspire you it also makes arguments about the different roles play um plays in children's lives that you might find interesting given the question is on your mind right now

board games are great for year olds although not generally the unstructured play you are referring to i would still try to find some that she enjoys and can sustain more attention to as so many skills can be incorporated and its a good opportunity to have uninterrupted time together it's also a little more fun for adults you can do simple card games or any strategy games it might be easier just to start infusing silliness and play into your every day routines for example when cooking together or eating we may pretend we are at a restaurant or royalty or part of beauty and the beast and start using different voices taking each others orders ecetera it isn't really planned just playing around play can just be building upon your relationship with each other we have the same overabundance of toys in our house but i have read that less is more in that department pre close by grandparents we had less toys and the kids actually played much better having so many things is distracting if you bring out something that lends itself to pretend play that interests her and leave everything else in another room you are in better shape

i hate playing too i only have a year old but i find she's happy if i talk to her while she's playing and let her lead the play also we do loads of stuff together that isn't play cooking cleaning etc but making it fun and enjoyable you said she likes to dance could you guys have a dance party learn a dance together

update so the first thing i did was that i finally gave in to her request to make slime i hate slime the smell of glue makes me gag i hate the wet slurpy labia sound it makes i hate the mess i hate everything about it but we’re in a pandemic so all bets are off i went to michaels and got the glue and we had a blast it was actually very relaxing i had fun layering it with colors and we chatted and laughed while we did it slime play achievement unlocked then she’s been really into soap cutting asmr so i took two nice expensive soaps i’ve been saving for whatever and showed her how to slice off little curls then we put it into a double boiler added some shimmer pigment stirred it up and made mini soap balls that was relaxing too plus the soap was lavender scented so extra sensory bonus plus our hands were super clean afterwards turning fancy soap into a toy achievement unlocked then this morning we were sitting around she was staring at her ipad and i was staring at my phone when all of a sudden i said “the floor is lava ” and we jumped into action climbing on furniture we made our way to the empty amazon boxes waiting to be recycled ripped them up and used some duct tape to make lava resistant boots then we shuffled around the house with our lava boots on for awhile floor is lava achievement unlocked we’ve also done some dance parties and stuff but mainly i’ve found success just following her lead and trying to find my way to yes it’s been kinda fun remembering how to be a kid again
we do that pretty frequently she prefers to choreograph her own dances and make me watch but sometimes she will dance with me

while play hasn't solved all problems i am continuously amazed that i see so few parents do it there are days where i am playful with my son from the moment we wake up to the moment we go to bed i use it as a carrot i use it for behavior modification for making mundane everyday tasks exciting and i use it because i happen to find it fun too take a simple example i am not by any means a brilliant playful parent but i'm proud of this one when the whole covid thing began my son needed to wash hands regularly but he didn't want to use hand sanitizer much less soap dispensers my girlfriend would butt heads with him multiple times a day about it you have to there is a virus out there it's not enough to simply rinse your hands etc the more you pressured the little dude the more stubborn and unwilling he became that is until the dispensers started making fart noises i'm sure i've fixed it it definitely won't make a farting noise now there is just no way dad has made it so it's completely quiet try it he pushed it and goes pffffrt while laughing hysterically we did it times and now it's never an issue to use dispensers i made up a similar game for applying sunscreen
i love the scavenger hunt idea
what did you play as a kid

that sounds so fun my son is still very young but i find i've somehow gravitated to making a lot of discipline a game like don't climb the stairs i'll pick you up and get you down but then he goes again and i pick him up again and put him down and then he gets this twinkle in his eye and before i know it i'm like too tee doo i'm an innocent mommy walking ar what is that no my baby wouldn't climb the stairs he wouldn't he what is he doing noooooooooooo the pick up monster is taking over and so on and it's a total blast for both of us and to my surprise he actually reduced the behavior or at least would try and catch my eye before he did it i'm a bit tongue in cheek when i describe cohen's book because well it's kind of like that it's not explicit this will solve all your problems parenting books usually aren't but then you get to the th example of the one trick solving a new completely unrelated problem and you start being like really this solved that too plenty of parenting books do that so it's not a strike against this one specifically but even if i don't want to over interpret its claims i did find it very interesting and valuable and i think its message that play solves a lot more problems than you'd think is probably correct

that's definitely the kind of game i would have played with my son at that age he's almost now i had this talk with another reddit user parenting books are by and large absolute garbage there are a few good ones in the bunch and i think the one you mention is one of them but then it goes too far and tries to use the same hammer for every problem i like the yale course everyday parenting the abcs of child rearing because it'd actually realistic down to earth and acknowledges that you will probably only get compliance from your kid of the time another issue with parenting advice is the kind of advice made by professionals with a theoretical background who clearly don't have kids themselves you know the kind they give advice on how to stop tantrums but fail to acknowledge or take into account how exhausted most parents probably are when attempting to apply their advice i remember reading a blog from a young child psychologist who wrote that it's super simple to teach a toddler what not to touch you simply say no in a calm voice and remove them from the object of interest yeah simple as fuck now try doing it times in a row on hours of sleep with vomit on your pants and while you're hurrying to a doctor's appointment it's not that the advice is wrong it's just that people really need to take into account the emotional state of the parent

i had a pc since i was with unrestricted access at i got access to the internet now i'm a very successful game developer working for the major players things learned lots of history i had encarta played praetorians age of mythology empire earth and a bunch of other games that had historical context english language my windows was in english which is not my first language that got me going and games taught me the rest the funny thing was that i was proficient at reading but i never made a connection that letters in books were the same as the ones on my pc so i believed i did not know how to read i started programming when i was or having a pc from an early age helped with that i started with basic then c then modding minecraft with java and eventually i stuck with c++ now at i decided that i had enough of c++ and i am trying to write more go code building a pc and which parts do what how to upgrade them and which parts i can mix and match my family went to the recycle yard a lot so they would bring me thrown away pcs they found my pc was always like something out of the mad max movie with pieces from the bunch of other pcs with the internet came a lot of bad things that i turned into positives with time i got addicted to league of legends but over time i realised time spent with friends is worth more than on video games realising that time spent with family is worth it came much later the value of money i used to spend a lot of money on league skins but eventually i realised that i can buy whole new games with that money and after that i realized that money is best spent at pubs i frequented with my highschool friends now when i'm an adult i think i'm really good with money and i never had any financial problems pcs really defined the way my life went and i think that i would be in a much worse place if my parents forbid me to have a pc as a kid all that being said now is a very different time with roblox minecraft p w servers lootboxes subscriptions on everything so i don't think my advice is relevant anymore you have a cs background so just do your best to parent in this digital age and i hope everything turns out ok

summertime routine for school age kids i am needing a bit of advice encouragement we are officially on summer break which has its positives and negatives lately my kids and hop on their computers first thing every morning to play minecraft roblox i sleep an extra hour and let them play while i make breakfast after breakfast we go outside swimming for a bit then head back inside for lunch i would rather them play video games than watch tv because there is some reading and strategy behind their games my question is what do your kids do when they wake up do you always wake up when they wake up thank you for any advice
my kids are around the same age and i do this if is so nice to get a bit of a sleep in sometimes i get up before them if we have plans to be ready but i love the slower down routine of the summer

my year old is usually in a day camp of some kind most weeks during the summer but there's sometimes the odd week where nothing is scheduled similar to weekends unless we have concrete plans i'll typically let him sleep in a little bit if he wants to when he gets up he will typically help himself to something small to eat he likes to eat something as soon as he wakes up i don't so that often is more like a snack to tide him over until i make us a proper breakfast he's allowed to read draw in his sketch book fuss around with whatever toys legos he's interested in at the time or go out in the back yard he's actually a very polite considerate kid so having him home during the day while i'm working is never an issue he'll choose activities that don't make a ton of noise he does have a switch and a tablet to play roblox and other games on but he doesn't have unrestricted access to these and he knows he needs permission to use them and that screen time is not something he's going to get every day

how to get my year old to stop lying my son won't stop lying almost on a weekly basis i've tried the soft approach where i tell him if he tells me the truth i will never punish him which i've kept my word on i've tried the hard approach where i take away the things he loves mainly roblox or electronics altogether i've tried talking to him by trying to make him understand why lying is bad by explaining to him that losing someone's trust is a big deal i've tried asking him what he would do if he were me and his child kept lying i don't know what else to do his most current lie was telling my wife he finished his hw this past thursday he came clean to me on friday and i didn't punish him but told him he needs to finish it before its due which is this coming monday i told him i didn't care when he got it done as long as he turned it in on time i told him forgetting to do it before monday was not a valid excuse so he said he'll do it that day which was friday because he didn't want to forget well he didn't do it on friday and now on sunday night my wife asked him about his hw and he said he wasn't done yet which means he lied when he said he would do it friday i made him write lines until his bedtime and i've restricted roblox to only on the weekends these punishments are futile as i've already gone down this road and nothing seems to work this is my first and only child and my parents come from the school of whooping ass which is not something i've ever done with my child i don't know what a normal parent would do since i don't have any references is this just typical kid behavior and i shouldn't make a big deal out of it am i overreacting am i failing as a parent

you're not failing as a parent the punishments you're choosing aren't really related to the problem though which may be why they aren't really working try this approach he's lied to you about doing his homework this means he cannot be trusted to do his homework independently therefore the logical consequence of this is that his homework must be supervised pick a time since the time he picks is never he doesn't get to choose and sit down with him and watch him do it repeat for anything else he's lying about

at years old i think you need to set the schedule still set a time for homework and have them do it somewhere near you homework shouldn't become a punishment which i fear is what you are making it into with line writing and taking away things the kid loves be nearby or check in during homework time to see if your kid needs any guidance give the kid more structure figure out if it works best doing homework directly after school or just before dinner or just after dinner let the kid pick when is best but then make sure it gets done if it can't be done in front of you ask them to show you their work once it's done and then say you worked so hard for so long or you got it all done too much responsibility is being left on them since they aren't getting it done already stop with the punishment and instead create better habits or your kid may end up hating learning homework etc

yeah last week me and him were watching a movie when i smelled an odor coming from him i smelled his armpits and they smelled terrible i asked him if he scrubbed his arm pits when he showered he said no so i made him write lines “i will shower properly” this was the nd time he got caught lying about washing his arm pit i didn’t punish him the st time because i don’t want to punish him for every single thing

um sounds like he needs deodorant he can scrub with steel wool in the shower but it will only last about minutes if he has hit the age where he needs deodorant which it sounds like he has doubt he even lied about it likewise you told him to get his homework done by monday and you punished him for not having done it on friday i understand he said he was going to but that was not a lie that was his plan but more than likely he got distracted or had other things to do but he knew it was fine as long as he did it before monday this is just bad planning because he is he still had time to do it the lying was when he said it was already done but he did not say that again on sunday night he said he still had to finish so he told the truth and you punished him for it he could have lied just gone and done it and not gotten punished

caught my son searching adult content i need some advice i f have a son m who loves youtube & roblox we have a computer that we'd put in his room because it was the best place to put in our house due to a lack of space he's also allowed to use my husband's phone to play roblox with his sister we do limit screentime & the computer has some intense parental controls but my husband's phone doesn't have these because it's his phone however my husband was going through his phone a while back & saw some p*rnographic pictures on there that he'd not saved there was also a very inappropriate video posted onto my husband's youtube account that had gotten flagged & taken down it had a video of woman in the background & my son face fully exposed in the foreground singing some youtube meme song we went through the phone & the computer & discovered that somehow our son had managed to turn off the parental controls & was searching p*rn we cleared the history so we could tell if he did it again reinstated parental controls & had a talk with him every talk has been met with extreme emotions he's on the autism spectrum & has always dealt with intense emotions we have to take breaks in discussions to calm him down before we can continue so this conversation was met with a ton of tears even some yelling and insisting it wasn't him all he does is sob & yell that he didn't do it we know for a fact that it was him it couldn't have been literally anyone else we even caught him in the act because we'd wanted to make sure we weren't misplacing the blame we figured out that when he wanted to search something up he'd shut his door & try to be very quiet turn down the volume everything he could to be inconspicuous but since his doorknob broke months ago & we haven't bothered to replace it yet we can still see into his room & caught him red handed i need to know what else i can do the computer has been removed from his room & the only way he's allowed on my husband's phone is when he's supervised & playing roblox with his sister we also figured out that my husband's phone has a kids mode that will keep him from searching things he shouldn't my biggest concern is what's made him want to look this stuff up he's never been exposed to any of this as far as we know we're very careful about not exposing our kids to adult things literally the only time he's not supervised by us is when he's with my parents who are even more strict than we are & when he's on the bus for school our only theory is that he's hearing things he shouldn't on the bus because he for some reason despite being a tiny year old gets placed in the back of the bus where all of the highschool kids sit he hates sitting back there these kids have been bad influences before & helped him get into trouble he's fully responsible for his behavior but peer pressure is pretty rough i'm sorry i know i'm rambling i just need some advice on what to do here
it's seriously driving me nuts if he was older i'd have a different sort of talk with him that's more candid but he's
honestly if he is already finding that stuff online it may be time for that different type of talk

if my kid already has an ipad is delaying a smart phone pointless i want to delay getting my year old a phone she wants one so bad because lots of her friends already have iphones but she currently just has an ipad i feel a little better about the ipad vs phone because the ability to take it everywhere isn’t there ipad stays home and also you can’t get all the apps you would on an iphone that is not to say my kid doesn’t already have roblox and capcut and a couple other games apps that need limits on them but overall she has decent boundaries around it daily screen time limit she can take it to sleepovers mostly so she has a way to call us via wi fi but not on regular play dates or anywhere day to day really we don’t let her take it to restaurants or have it on during meals at home not even car rides that are less than an hour now we could make all these same rules for a phone but probably would be harder to stick as one of the main benefits is she’d be able to take it with her to after school activities bike rides day to day stuff when we do end up getting her a phone we’re leaning towards a dumb phone only question is for parents who have experience is it pointless with an ipad already if we get her an iphone will there be significantly more harm than just an ipad

i need to understand more about why you want to delay what are you concerned about i just recently got my year old a phone because he was traveling with another family for vacation but i’m not super concerned about screen time either i have a year old and year old for reference and they both got phones around years old but i didn’t have a set age just when it felt like it made sense and i haven’t seen any harmful effects there are a few kids whose parents waited longer and i definitely felt like those kids missed a lot by not being part of the online social elements of their groups
trade the ipad for the iphone and treat it the same

the ipad stays at home that's the difference mom and dad can grab it at any time and check it they can look at the screen and make sure she's not doing anything wrong a phone in her pocket that's different that's a tiny computer she carries everywhere including school that the parents have little to no control over because they aren't physically there
mostly because i’ve been told over and over and over by parents whose kids have phones to wait as long as i can

gotcha i think people sometimes don’t know what they’re worried about they’ve just heard screen time is bad but to me learning how to manage social media and online communication is a critical skill in todays world and if you start in middle school you have a lot better chance of teaching them healthy habits rather than them feeling behind and trying desperately to catch up later it’s all personal choice but if your kid is well rounded and has a bunch of activities and interests some screen time is not going to hurt

id say at those ages its fair to expect them to be in their bedrooms quiet but they dont have to sleep theyre old enough to know when they need sleep and to suffer the consequences of not getting enough this is a great time for them to learn their natural limits on their own keep electronics out of bedrooms so theres no temptation to stay up later but they can certainly read or draw or whatever quietly in their rooms until they are ready to sleep turn off the wifi otherwise and just get to sleep make them stay in their bedrooms and after that its not your job to worry if they sleep or not

this was a hard switch for my husband too i just told him it was time you can't be awake with them forever and we had no reason to not trust them they don't need us up they are doing their own thing too we started during our summer so they had time work it out how to manage themselves we have our wifi on a timer for midnight every night my oldest is he stays up until ish every night my year old goes to bed about most nights they have alarms for the days they need to get up early it was hard for me to let go and see how they handle it they have figured out when they need to go to bed earlier because they are tired or because they need to get up earlier it has been good practice for them they have learned a lot in the beginning my year old stayed up until am everyday for a few weeks and then realized how tired he was and it wasn't worth it

minecraft is on many different systems you can play it on a computer a tablet or a gaming console depends on how or where you she wants to play a tablet is probably your cheapest option a nintendo switch would be a good option if she wants to play both on the go like a tablet and on the tv since it can do both it would also let you get other games even ones you could play with her if that's any interest a computer will be potentially the best long term option as it can handle the largest worlds mods extra stuff but at she may or may not be interested in that stuff yet

nintendo switch would be your best bet or a controller for minecraft mobile for her tablet although the switch is better imo minecraft mobile is a sad version of the game according to my year old who bought it last year also if you were to get her an xbox it can do cloud gaming through game pass and the console itself onto her tablet with a controller but that requires a really good connection on both the whole time think remote desktop for computer type situation xbox turns on and immediately displays the same thing onto the tablet i used it when i was in labor with my son and didn't want to haul the xbox with me lol

id say a switch just also buy the accessories to protect it my daughter is and she's been playing switch since she was and we still have the same handheld we have my girl playing minecraft on pc because i host a server and it helps with her typing but i recently learned over half her school friends play on switch

heads up though the switch is pretty fragile it’s probably fine for kids that are relatively pacific but my adhd year old was hard on it and it broke pretty quickly was an expensive lesson if it’s just for minecraft just about any old phone or tablet should be able to play it though and if you’re tech savvy enough most newer tv’s have the ability to mirror your phone’s screen so you can use the phone as the controller and watch the game on the tv this wouldn’t normally be a good switch alternative but again minecraft is on everything

no hobbies wasting away on screens year old son doesn’t play any sports rarely leaves the house completely miserable when he’s not sitting at his laptop wasting away on roblox legitimately his attitude completely changes if i let him would sit on his phone all day every day kid hates me because i have to take his phone or laptop away on a regular basis otherwise he would spend every single waking hour on the screen this is not an exaggeration he lies to me about it and is constantly sneaking around sometimes up until am or later on discord on a school night we go to dinner he refuses to eat because i’ll ask him to put away the phone and two minutes later he’s got it in his lap typing away i don’t know what to do any more the kid legit hates me for trying to guide him away from wasting his life behind a screen if he had even a single thing in his life that brought him joy a single hobby or sport i’d leave him alone but he doesn’t do i just stop trying to guide him let him waste away trying to “break” his habit has done nothing but make him hate me

set boundaries it’s more than acceptable to have *everyone* off of screens during meal time if he cannot be responsible with bed time then his screens should be taken at x time on school nights but maybe leave weekends open and let him do his thing as long as he is still able to take care of his responsibilities middle school and early high school are all hell he may be feeling lonely or having a hard time connecting with friends at school or maybe he has a lot of online friends i know my so had a lot of online friends before he got acquainted with more people here he moved to this area when he was and his online friends really helped him ask if there are any hobbies or extra curricular activities he’s interested in joining if not then see if there’s a way to connect in gaming with him it’s okay if gaming is the hobby that is joy to him

we tell our kids that they have to something i don't care what but they need to pick one organized activity my year old doesn't like sports either but is involved in theater and just got into lego robotics he loves both but probably wouldn't have started doing either if not for our rule

i had a gaming addiction when i was a teenager i would spend every waking minute online gaming i'd hurry meals to get back to it my dad would walk into my room at am and bark at me to turn off my pc my virtual life was my life i literally spent at least hours a day online i really wish my parents had made an intervention early on it was only in my early twenties and losing my first girlfriend that i but rock bottom and realised what i had to do it really sounds like your son is experiencing addiction he needs medical help to address what is underlying and fueling his addiction he needs to be cut off i would certainly seek help in the first instance as when you do cut him off all hell will break loose any action less that stopping this addiction will elicit the minimum response necessary to get you off his back so he can get right back to it i've been there this is going to be hard for you you sound like a great dad but you need to do this to help him in the long run i reckon i wasted years of my life through my gaming addiction

there is a huge screen issue with kids and some adults but maybe you're trying too hard maybe he doesn't like sports or theatre or has social anxiety pushing to those with social anxiety feels like being pushed into a crocodile pit is he an introvert that adds a lot i'm a major introvert and don't like any sports and big groups wig me out i was happiest when i read a book or chatted online i had friends that were similar so if helped instead of pushing what you think he should do but see who he is and what would be good for him fyi certain games do have an online community i rped for years and now write stories and talk to other writers that's my happy place you're not wrong for caring and wanting the best sometimes with introverts it's just a little more difficult

i’m going to be honest and i hope not to offend anyone i’ve been a long time gamer started at yr old i’ve had phases where i drop gaming for years at a time but i always seem to end up back at a computer i have the ability to literally sit for hours straight even at it’s not a healthy habit it is an addiction to escape not even about the games anymore i just want to be left alone now that i am a father of beautiful boys i find myself waiting until the boys and wife are asleep so i can sneak away this has destroyed my sleep schedule and no matter how exhausted i am i still stay up until am every night just trying to get my alone time i hope this shows how gaming can be a real issue the stimulation from gaming is almost the same as drug use the times i took a break from gaming before kids i found myself partying hard and fulfilling my addiction for escape in many other ways drugs shows relationships the reason i bring all this up is because it’s concerning i’m a good man i take great care of my family house etc but i still have the itch and am constantly depressed i think even if he hates you taking away all electronics is a great approach he may go through withdrawals etc but at least maybe that break may show him what other avenues he can explore with your guidance always remember the amount of time you put into an addiction is about half the time it will take to break it coming from an addict for all things escape try to show him not to sorry if that was a ramble

it’s hard we have a similar problem we just started non electronic time and no screens at dinner all electronics are charged in living room including kids phones none in their rooms if he is sneaky charge in your room it will be very hard at first but be consistent and firm we started small hour increments and have been able to increase the time also we turn off all electronics an hour and half before bed they shower and read or do whatever also be available for hanging out or board games during that time eventually it will get better but you will probably have a battle for a few weeks also if he goes around bugging people then he doesn’t get his stuff back he’s old enough to talk to and say what the expectations are in the family and those electronics are privileges not rights it sucked when we got serious but it’s good now still have to make sure they get off but it’s worth it also i sometimes watch my kids play and talk to them about their game or cheer them on and it has let us bond better by showing interest in their interests then it’s easier when they have to get off to want to be around me good luck

whether it's a computer game or any other activity this isn't healthy if he cannot step away from it to eat a meal and is up until am doing it when he needs to be sleeping he has a problem if he fights you every time you address it it's a problem honestly if it's as bad as you say i'd get him into counseling they can work with him to build up a plan to help with this all and then let you know what your role is

kids need to hours of outdoor exercise every day and social interaction and its' your job to enforce that at a lot of kids would just eat and watch stuff all day if they could that can't be allowed some reddit parents will say that this is normal and your son is just an introvert but most doctors would disagree get him into some organized activities so that he can be physically active even if he goes kicking and screaming surely there must be something outdoors that he likes screens are easier but that doesn't mean there's no joy to be had in other things physical activity is absolutely necessary to health and brain development not exercise every day for a decent amount of time at this age will set your son up for huge problems not only now but down the road the damage done now can't be undone as it affects how his body develops put a list of available local activities in front of him and tell him he has to go to two consider going cold turkey on the screen time outside of school for the whole family because he sounds addicted

there is legitimate screen addiction… have you tried talking to his pediatrician to gage what’s normal you could also go cold turkey and be okay with him being mad at you for a while and take all internet devices away except for a designated time for school purposes and a tv family night do a total extinction method for screens kind of thing he’ll me max he’ll yell he’ll say he hates you but long term it’ll be better for him — a parent’s job is not to be liked but to love their kid and sometimes that means doing things the kids don’t like

computer screen experience for kids my kids are in first and third grade and so far they haven’t had much exposure to electronics they watch tv shows and movies on the weekend on streaming services on tv which we monitor but i keep screens off during the week including phones so they have never played anything on a tablet or switch or games like roblox or minecraft when we go on road trips any drive longer than hours they watch dvds in the car otherwise they enjoy listening to stories and podcasts for kids they do not use electronics of any kind for school they are doing well academically and i regularly read chapter books to them not to say they’re bored quite the opposite they do a lot of sports take music lessons and enjoy playing with friends swim in the pool and play with mud insects and more on our yard after school however as idyllic as that all sounds i can’t help feeling that perhaps they’re missing out on their development especially in this high tech world there are so many educational apps out there and they have zero computer or phone knowledge they don’t know how to use my phone and at all except to take pictures are they missing out tldr should i introduce more screen time to my kids

they're having a different experience from most of their peers but that doesn't mean they're missing out that said there are definite positives to *certain* video games the school computers at our school come preloaded with minecraft education and both my first and second grader play standard minecraft on my switch a few times a week for about minutes you should see the kind of creativity and problem solving the game encourages they love making things and showing off their creations minecraft is one game i'd recommend without hesitation stay far away from anything primarily online like roblox though also i don't have to tell you that if they truly have *zero* experience operating electronics of any kind then they'll definitely be at a temporary disadvantage when electronics are introduced at school but it should be only temporary i know this probably isn't super helpful if you *do* choose to introduce games do it with limits and a lot of research stay far away from online games because anything that introduced random people into the experience is an increasingly dangerous gamble but know that some video games like minecraft are legitimately positive experiences

yo keeps facetiming me because his other side of the family is leaves him on the ipad writing this post mainly to see if anyone else has this problem in a split divorced situation i love my son so much but sometimes he calls me too much i am a single father & he lives with his mom we play minecraft & roblox almost everyday i try to limit it to about minutes but mostly bleeds into mins which is fine but i feel like his other side is doing him a disservice i understand you can’t do activities with him all the time & a little ipad time is fine but on saturdays & sundays he will be on it for hours straight this troubles me whenever i have him over every other weekend we are mostly filling time with various things & i try to minimize the ipad as much as possible it seems we have different parenting styles when it comes to this or they’re just lazy i don’t call them out or bring it up because it has caused fights in the past is this relatable to anyone what are your thoughts on this

it’s relatable but there’s not much you can do unless your ex comes to you with something like “he’s having issues at our house do you have any advice ” part of splitting up is probably your inability to get on the same page about different points of view so going at your ex with unsolicited parenting advice is almost certainly a recipe for being completely ignored at best or being attacked for butting into their lives at worst you are each legally allowed to make whatever parenting decisions you want at your house without the other house being part of those decisions

so your pets will destroy open it coins come out and you can used the coins to buy eggs from which you get better pets rolled on a random loot table and then you go on to the next area where the boxes books like storey treehouse all of those fall kind of in the same kind of 'dopamine rush' stuff

is it ok to tell children to “shut up it’s dad’s concentrating time” i am generally not a strict parent and have trouble telling them off unless one or the other is likely to actually get hurt or if one is likely to really upset the other i know this isn’t always the best way to be but that’s how i am so when a child does something annoying and keeps doing it regardless of what i do i’m likely to ask them to stop a couple of times i’ve long given up trying to reason or argue logic with them distract them bribe them and then if they are still doing it explode and give them a disproportionate punishment it goes without saying that this isn’t the best approach and has mixed results so what is the right thing to do if they aren’t being naughty but just annoying i often feel i don’t know what is reasonable and what is not i am considering a new tactic and wanted some feedback as to whether it’s weird unreasonable etc i love my seven year old he can be so much fun and he is so full of energy he is most likely autistic i probably am too what ever he is doing he tends to commentate it’s very annoying he is playing roblox at the moment and he keeps telling me about it but he expects me to look and he looks over to check i am we played a fair amount together today we usually do so i don’t feel guilty that i want to sit here in the same room and read some stuff i want to read some news or some articles on a website maybe i want to write something a blog post or some hobby coding but i need to concentrate for more than seconds at a time i don’t want to stop several times a minute and see what car his roblox character is driving is it unreasonable to put headphones in and tell him repeatedly if he keeps interrupting that daddy is concentrating so stfu i wouldn’t actually say it that way 😝

i mean i wouldn’t say it’s ok to tell a kid to “shut up” but i think it’s ok to say you need some quiet time or that you’re busy right now it’s not good for a kid to get used to having attention all the time anyway maybe you could set a timer maybe even a visual one so he can see how much time is left

setting boundaries is important it helps teach kids consent and empathy i highly recommend looking into response parenting and gentle parenting there’s a way to do it where you validate their feelings but give yourself the time you need to recharge check out biglittlefeelings curious parenting and drbeckyatgoodinside on instagram for good tips and foundation big little feelings is more for toddlers but can be adapted to kids i also recommend mommacusses because she shows a different side of gentle parenting which may resonate
if you suspect your both on the spectrum use that to your advantage most of us love routines so maybe from on the weekends is independent play time
i wouldn’t say stfu but if you have work or school to do then you gotta get it done if it’s recreational then just ask him to give you a minute while you finish so you can focus on him

i think this comes down to parenting style choices i generally practice gentle parenting but like you i sometimes get too lenient and then i get kinda explosive my daughter literally talks from the second she wakes up to when she falls asleep no one can stand her for more than a few minutes so i’ll be straight with her and be like “hey your annoying me can i get a little break” we also tell our kids we are “off duty” so i’ll go to my room and just say “moms off duty go to your dad if you need something” and if i have a project i don’t want to be interrupted in for example today i was hanging a shelf i’ll tell the kids “hey i’m about to go hang this shelf it will take me like minutes i’ll be off duty the whole time only come to me if it’s an emergency”— but giving them a little heads up seems to help a lot but here’s the thing we are trying to prepare our kids for the world and in the world if you are being fucking annoying people are going to get annoyed with you and that’s just life so i don’t think there is anything wrong with calmly saying “hey you’re bugging me i’m working on something i’ll check out your roblox cars when i’m done having my own time”

autistic mom to an autistic year old boy and can confirm these little dudes definitely like an audience my son will also check to make sure i’m watching whether he’s playing a game or showing me a video he also makes me answer questions to make sure i’m paying attention if he shows me a drawing or comic and i tell him i like it he asks what my favorite part is he’s just super excited about his hobbies he wants to share his excitement with anyone and everyone keep in mind that a kid like this is gonna face some social rejection even though his interests may be popular with other kids because he lacks the social awareness and impulse control to understand that most kids don’t make friends by info dumping at each other so it’s important that you teach him how to hold a proper conversation along with how to tell if someone is bored or annoyed also important that you seek out places for him to share his excitement with people in an environment where his enthusiasm will be appreciated— clubs leagues classes conventions etc the more he gets to channel his interests into opportunities for learning and social connection the less his excitement will manifest as unwanted behavior or internal shame you want to be careful not to be your kid’s first bully either just because you want your kid to stop annoying you doesn’t mean you have to make them feel bad for it teaching a lesson in the moment should generally be avoided because you’re likely to be impatient and your kid is already distracted the only message they’ll be taking away is that you wanted them to stop talking instead when you want to concentrate take preventative measures schedule your quiet time to take place after you’ve had good quality time with your kid tell him what to expect and for how long “i will be unavailable to watch or comment on anything for the next minutes while i concentrate on x if it’s not an emergency please do not interrupt i love you and it’s important for me to have this time to focus ” and make this a regular practice spend time practicing social interactions with your kid regularly and suggest alternatives to talking for times when it’s inappropriate— like making a video writing or creating something with the topic as inspiration good luck you got this
explain adults need quiet time to relax maybe make it a fun game if he lets you work he can have something in return

yes very normal is kind of that age where they learn… everything her friends will have older siblings or cousins in middle school and everything is fair game by then they love sharing with their younger sibs you can’t shield her from the information but you can have honest and open conversations about every topic she brings up if she brings up non binary talk very intensely about what it is and what it means do not assume she knows the correct definition and application as you appear to already have a good start with it’s better for her to hear the truth from you than misinformation from others a funny relevant story when i was exactly ten i told my dad i was half lesbian he was extremely taken aback wasn’t sure where i had learned about it and started asking more questions this was way before discord btw kids just find out anyway turns out i asked my grandma what lesbian meant and she said it’s the same thing as lebanese she was trying to avoid the conversation and didn’t think i was old enough so in my mind lesbian=lebanese were interchangeable i thought that for months a very educational moment for us both and i was thrilled he was honest and open with the definition of lesbian unlike my grandmother was as i immediately felt the failure she set me up for by not explaining it to me when she could thank goodness my dad was open honest and gentle with the explanation or i could have embarrassed myself horridly in a different situation

how would you handle an overly involved helicopter parent throwaway account…… so my daughter has had a friend in her friend group since yrs old pre k she’s now yrs old they go to school together i’ve known this mother as a parent at the school we never became friends but i’ve always remained friendly i’m an involved parent volunteer at my daughters school know her teachers help with homework and overall have a great relationship with my daughter i’m a good mother but as she gets older i believe she needs to navigate her own friendships i’m always there to listen if she has an issue or needs advice but overall she has a nice little friend group they’re a good group of kids however there is one girl whose mother has become overly involved in her daughters life to the point it is beyond helicopter parenting it’s like she has inserted herself into the friend group it’s… kind of weird honestly for example our girls there’s in the group have a group chat where they talk play roblox together or just facetime chat together there’s always lots of giggling and my daughter will share with me funny comments or stories sometimes however it has come to my attention that this heli mom will read their chats listen in on their conversations etc and then proceed to message the other parents she’s never messaged me complaining about what she heard or read and how they need to talk to their daughters about their behavior another parent in the friend group brought this to my attention as she was confused and looked through the texts but saw nothing concerning this prompted me to talk to my daughter and ask to see her texts i would like to point out i believe in protecting privacy and i trust my daughter i would never look through messages unless out of concern such as this and she knows that so together she and i went though her group chat and i also saw nothing concerning it was chatting about school stupid funny memes and roblox this heli mom wouldn’t elaborate to the other mom except to say that our daughters weren’t being “good digital citizens”… like what i believe this woman is controlling and bored and has no life or friendships outside of her daughter and is therefore inserting herself into her daughters personal life and friendships the worst part is the child of this woman is very sweet and likable but her mother is making it impossible for her to have her own friends imo knowing that my daughters own privacy would be invaded if she stays friends with this girl i’m considering suggesting she spend less time with her and not chat with her outside of school i hate this as i feel it has forced me to invade in her friendships thoughts or feedback * the above example is one issue i was also recently informed by another parent in their friend group that they no longer allow their daughter to hang out with heli mom’s daughter bc of similar overly involved behavior by heli mom *edit this isn’t about internet access i know and understand the importance of monitoring what kids see and do online my daughter doesn’t have unfiltered or unlimited access to the internet it’s about this mother reading their group texts they had via their ipads my daughter doesn’t have a phone listening to their conversations and then i don’t know commenting on it like texting the other parents that they aren’t including her daughter enough in their girls aren’t asking her daughter enough questions or something i don’t know

my year old won’t play with toys hi parents so my year old son has stopped playing with toys he doesn’t even want to go outside to play he just wants to play roblox minecraft and other video games is this normal for their age i really push him to go outside to play but eventually he asks ti play video games i have tried so many different approaches and bought so many toys and other age appropriate activities that only last a few days
